alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 12:36PM AKST until January 02 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 1 inch and ice accumulations of a glaze up to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph along Cook Inlet. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. Areas of blowing snow along Cook Inlet could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of mixed precipitation will persist through tonight. Snow and blowing snow along the Sterling Highway from Anchor Point to Kenai could lead to low visibilities. Some areas will warm above freezing today, especially inland toward Cooper Landing. Areas near the Inlet will likely hover right near the freezing mark.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
